#Text=CHAPTER XII
#Text=The Rev. Mr. Ware found Levi Gorringe 's law-office readily enough , but its owner was not in .
#Text=He probably would be back again , though , in a quarter of an hour or so , the boy said , and the minister at once decided to wait .
#Text=Theron was interested in finding that this office-boy was no other than Harvey -- the lad who brought milk to the parsonage every morning .

#Text=He remembered now that he had heard good things of this urchin , as to the hard work he did to help his mother , the Widow Semple , in her struggle to keep a roof over her head ; and also bad things , in that he did not come regularly either to church or Sunday-school .
#Text=The clergyman recalled , too , that Harvey had impressed him as a character .

#Text=“ Well , sonny , are you going to be a lawyer ? ” he asked , as he seated himself by the window , and looked about him , first at the dusty litter of old papers , pamphlets , and tape-bound documents in bundles which crowded the stuffy chamber , and then at the boy himself .

#Text=Harvey was busy at a big box -- a rough pine dry-goods box which bore the flaring label of an express company , and also of a well-known seed firm in a Western city , and which the boy had apparently just opened .

#Text=He was lifting from it , and placing on the table after he had shaken off the sawdust and moss in which they were packed , small parcels of what looked in the fading light to be half-dried plants .
#Text=“ Well , I do n't know -- I rather guess not , ” he made answer , as he pursued his task .
#Text=“ So far as I can make out , this would n't be the place to start in at , if I WAS going to be a lawyer .
#Text=A boy can learn here first-rate how to load cartridges and clean a gun , and braid trout-flies on to leaders , but I do n't see much law laying around loose .
#Text=Anyway , ” he went on , “ I could n't afford to read law , and not be getting any wages .
#Text=I have to earn money , you know . ”
#Text=Theron felt that he liked the boy .
#Text=“ Yes , ” he said , with a kindly tone ; “ I 've heard that you are a good , industrious youngster .
#Text=I daresay Mr. Gorringe will see to it that you get a chance to read law , and get wages too . ”

#Text=“ Oh , I can read all there is here and welcome , ” the boy explained , stepping toward the window to decipher the label on a bundle of roots in his hand , “ but that 's no good unless there 's regular practice coming into the office all the while .
#Text=THAT'S how you learn to be a lawyer .
#Text=But Gorringe do n't have what I call a practice at all .
#Text=He just sees men in the other room there , with the door shut , and whatever there is to do he does it all himself . ”
#Text=The minister remembered a stray hint somewhere that Mr. Gorringe was a money-lender -- what was colloquially called a “ note-shaver . ”
#Text=To his rustic sense , there was something not quite nice about that occupation .
#Text=It would be indecorous , he felt , to encourage further talk about it from the boy .
#Text=“ What are you doing there ? ” he inquired , to change the subject .
#Text=“ Sorting out some plants , ” replied Harvey .
#Text=“ I do n't know what 's got into Gorringe lately .
#Text=This is the third big box he 's had since I 've been here -- that is , in six weeks -- besides two baskets full of rose-bushes .
#Text=I do n't know what he does with them .
#Text=He carries them off himself somewhere .
#Text=I 've had kind of half a notion that he 's figurin ' on getting married .
#Text=I ca n't think of anything else that would make a man spend money like water -- just for flowers and bushes .
#Text=They do get foolish , you know , when they 've got marriage on the brain . ”
#Text=Theron found himself only imperfectly following the theories of the young philosopher .
#Text=It was his fact that monopolized the minister 's attention .

#Text=“ But as I understand it , ” he remarked hesitatingly , “ Brother Gorringe -- or rather Mr. Gorringe -- gets all the plants he wants , everything he likes , from a big garden somewhere outside .
#Text=I do n't know that it is exactly his ; but I remember hearing something to that effect . ”
#Text=The boy slapped the last litter off his hands , and , as he came to the window , shook his head .
#Text=“ These do n't come from no garden outside , ” he declared .
#Text=“ They come from the dealers ' , and he pays solid cash for ' em .
#Text=The invoice for this lot alone was thirty-one dollars and sixty cents .
#Text=There it is on the table .
#Text=You can see it for yourself . ”
#Text=Mr. Ware did not offer to look .
#Text=“ Very likely these are for the garden I was speaking of , ” he said .
#Text=“ Of course you ca n't go on taking plants out of a garden indefinitely without putting others in . ”
#Text=“ I do n't know anything about any garden that he takes plants out of , ” answered Harvey , and looked meditatively for a minute or two out upon the street below .
#Text=Then he turned to the minister .
#Text=“ Your wife 's doing a good deal of gardening this spring , I notice , ” he said casually .
#Text=“ You 'd hardly think it was the same place , she 's fixed it up so .
#Text=If she wants any extra hoeing done , I can always get off Saturday afternoons . ”
#Text=“ I will remember , ” said Theron .
#Text=He also looked out of the window ; and nothing more was said until , a few moments later , Mr. Gorringe himself came in .
